EMAIL:
Hi! Thanks for using the Christian Life Survey. This survey allows you to assess your spiritual life in a new way. The survey will help you take a look at the center points of your spiritual life, your preferred spiritual ways of life and, based on your answers, will suggest some ways to engage scripture. 
 When you've answered all the questions, your personalized results will be emailed to you. To send you your personal summary results we need an email address. This email address will not be shared with anyone, ever. Your personal results will not be shared with anyone ever. 
You can choose to not do this survey for any reason at any time without any consequences of any kind. Only the results from participants 18 or older will be included in analyses and reporting. Your participation and responses to the survey indicate your consent for your results to be included in any summary results we report (your personal results will never be shared with anyone).


 Please enter an email address:
GROUP_CODE:
Did someone at your church, or college, or other group ask you to take this self-assessment? Did they provide a code phrase for you to use? 
If they did, please enter that phrase EXACTLY as you received it.

Your results will be joined with the results of everyone in the group. The folks in charge will not receive your individual results, they will only receive summaries that combine the results of everyone in the group. If you have one, please enter your group code:
QID4: Have you completed this survey before? We need to make sure summaries of how people generally respond do not include the same people multiple times. You're very welcome to take the survey as often as you wish, but it would help us to know if this is your first time taking the survey.

Q122: In general, what we think we know for certain about physical, social, or theological reality, might actually be wrong.
Q123: Reality almost always works in a predictable, logical way.
Q124: Reality works in complicated ways and often turns out differently than expected.
